snippet: The insects innately use vibration to cause the release of pollen from some flowers....
abstract: Bumble bees sometimes extract pollen from plants by biting pollen structures called anthers and using vibration from buzzing to make pollen fall out; scientists say process, called sonication, or buzz pollination, is instinctual.
lead_paragraph: The insects innately use vibration to cause the release of pollen from some flowers.

headline.print_headline: Sciencetake; Hungry Bumble Bees Buzz for Their Suppers
